table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG] [Python] Generated files with syntax errors if spec contains 204 response

#### Bug Report Checklist
- [x] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [x] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apidevtools.org/swagger-parser/online/))? - [x] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [x] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [x] What's the actual output vs expected output? - [ ] [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request ([example](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6178))
<!-- Please follow the issue template below for bug reports. Also please indicate in the issue title which language/library is concerned. Eg: [BUG][JAVA] Bug generating foo with bar -->
##### Description
<!-- describe what is the question, suggestion or issue and why this is a problem for you. -->
Generated `python` codes have syntax errors when a spec file contains `204 No Content` response. This is caused by type hint `typing.Union` without any type arguments.
```python @dataclass class ApiResponseFor204(api_client.ApiResponse): response: urllib3.HTTPResponse body: typing.Union[ # syntax error ] headers: schemas.Unset = schemas.unset ```
(Note: `typing.Union` requires one or more type arguments https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html#typing.Union)
##### openapi-generator version
<!-- which version of openapi-generator are you using, is it a regression? -->
v6.2.1 (and master branch)
##### OpenAPI declaration file content or url
<!-- if it is a bug, a json or yaml that produces it. If you post the code inline, please wrap it with ```yaml (here your code) ``` (for YAML code) or ```json (here your code) ``` (for JSON code), so it becomes more readable. If it is longer than about ten lines, please create a Gist (https://gist.github.com) or upload it somewhere else and link it here. -->
Gist link: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Syuparn/0a9d22599b087f61ddfd5beb7bcbc26a/raw/62d003fc54d8df3e97251d6e33103b89a738fd7c/sample.yaml
This is originated from https://swagger.io/docs/specification/2-0/describing-responses/ `Empty Response Body` sample.
##### Generation Details
<!-- Prefer CLI steps, including the language, libraries and various options. Providing config-based settings allows for simpler testing across CLI and plugins. For examples, see https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/tree/master/bin/configs -->
##### Steps to reproduce
<!-- unambiguous set of steps to reproduce the bug.-->
```bash $ docker run --rm -v "${PWD}:/local" openapitools/openapi-generator-cli generate \ -i https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Syuparn/0a9d22599b087f61ddfd5beb7bcbc26a/raw/62d003fc54d8df3e97251d6e33103b89a738fd7c/sample.yaml \ -g python \ -o /local/out/python ```
`out/python/openapi_client/paths/report/delete.py` has the syntax errors written above.
##### Related issues/PRs
- https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/12265 - https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/pull/12287
##### Suggest a fix
<!-- if you can't fix the bug yourself, perhaps you can point to what might be causing the problem (line of code or commit), or simply make a suggestion -->
This type hint should be `schemas.Unset`. Template is intended to render `schemas.Unset` type hint when a body (`content`) is empty.
https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/blob/master/modules/openapi-generator/src/main/resources/python/endpoint.handlebars#L164
However, this is unexpectedly treated as non-empty value because `content`, which is `LinkedHashMap`, is always treated as truthy by conditional blocks `{{#if}}`, `{{#or}}`, and, `{{#and}}`.
- definition of `content` key https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/blob/master/modules/openapi-generator/src/main/java/org/openapitools/codegen/CodegenResponse.java#L92 - handlebars function definition (used for `{{#if}}`, `{{#or}}`, `{{#and}}` blocks): https://github.com/jknack/handlebars.java/blob/master/handlebars/src/main/java/com/github/jknack/handlebars/Handlebars.java#L200
To fix the issue, we need another way to check whether `content` is empty (adding boolean flag `hasContent` to `CodegenResponse` class for example).

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG] Maven Plugin creates (empty) directories if contained files are ignored

##### Description
When I instruct the Maven Plugin to not generate (i.e., ignore) files in a certain directory, then these files are not generated (as expected), but still the related directory gets created (and remains empty).
Example: I write in my .openapi-generator-ignore file: `**/invoker/**`
As expected, none of the contained files gets generated, but I end up with an empty `invoker` directory.
##### openapi-generator version 4.0.0-beta3
##### Suggest a fix I would expect that the code generator ensures that no generated + empty directories are present after the generation. Either you check during the generation whether any file will be generated inside or you create the directory at first and then clean up later on.

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column:
#### Bug Report Checklist
- [x] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [x] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apidevtools.org/swagger-parser/online/))? - [x] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [x] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [x] What's the actual output vs expected output? - [ ] [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request ([example](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6178))
##### Description
The original order of the securitySchemes is lost during the code generation and replaced with an alphabetical order.
When parsing the following OpenAPI file the outcome is a list of `List<CodegenSecurity>` sorted alphabetically, in this case `[api_key, petstore_auth]`
``` securitySchemes: petstore_auth: type: oauth2 flows: implicit: authorizationUrl: 'http://petstore.swagger.io/api/oauth/dialog' scopes: 'write:pets': modify pets in your account 'read:pets': read your pets api_key: type: apiKey name: api_key in: header
```
The code generation should not alter the order from the OpenAPI specs (this order is relevant for tools and applications that work with the securityScheme).
The expected output is a`List<CodegenSecurity>` with the original order`[petstore_auth, api_key]`
##### openapi-generator version
Found on `6.3.0-SNAPSHOT`.
##### Generation Details
It can be reproduced with an OpenAPI specs defining multiple `securitySchemes`, see `DefaultCodegenTest.testOauthMultipleFlows`

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: With `modelNamePrefix` set to `Foo`, all occurrences of `AnyCodable` in the generated models get named `FooAnyCodable`. Any ideas on how to fix this? I couldn't figure out where this happens exactly.

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG][python-nextgen] Cannot handle query parameters with non-ref enums

#### Bug Report Checklist
- [x] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [x] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apidevtools.org/swagger-parser/online/))? - [x] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [x] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [x] What's the actual output vs expected output? - [ ] [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request ([example](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6178))
<!-- Please follow the issue template below for bug reports. Also please indicate in the issue title which language/library is concerned. Eg: [BUG][JAVA] Bug generating foo with bar -->
##### Description
https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/pull/15278 does not seem to work correctly.
The below schema creates the function signature, one of them an enum, the other a string:
```py query_param_with_named_enum : QueryParamEnum, query_param_without_named_enum : StrictStr ```
But still tries to access both values with `.value`:
```py # process the query parameters _query_params = [] if _params.get('query_param_with_named_enum') is not None: # noqa: E501 _query_params.append(('queryParamWithNamedEnum', _params['query_param_with_named_enum'].value))
if _params.get('query_param_without_named_enum') is not None: # noqa: E501 _query_params.append(('queryParamWithoutNamedEnum', _params['query_param_without_named_enum'].value)) ```
##### openapi-generator version
6.6.0
##### OpenAPI declaration file content or url
```yaml openapi: 3.0.1 info: title: "" version: "" paths: /test/endpoint: get: parameters: - name: queryParamWithNamedEnum in: query required: true schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/QueryParamEnum' - name: queryParamWithoutNamedEnum in: query required: true schema: type: string enum: - ValueA - ValueB responses: 200: description: OK components: schemas: QueryParamEnum: type: string enum: - ValueC - ValueD ```
##### Related issues/PRs
https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/pull/15133 https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/pull/15278
##### Suggest a fix
Short-term: Do not use `.value` on raw string.
Long-term: Restrict the allowed values for non-ref enums somehow, maybe with a custom model or the [literal type](https://docs.pydantic.dev/latest/usage/types/#literal-type). This might be breaking for some users.

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG][JAVA] Include minimum and maximum values in arrays with number items

#### Bug Report Checklist
- [X] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [X] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apidevtools.org/swagger-parser/online/))? - [X] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [X] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [X] What's the actual output vs expected output? - [ ] [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request ([example](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6178))
<!-- Please follow the issue template below for bug reports and feature requests. Also please indicate in the issue title which language/library is concerned. Eg: [JAVA] Bug generating foo with bar -->
##### Description
<!-- describe what is the question, suggestion or issue and why this is a problem for you. -->
The current spring generator generates validator annotation, which excludes the minimum and maximum values ofr numbers in an array. Instead of ```java @Valid private List<@DecimalMin(value = "1", inclusive = false) @DecimalMax(value = "10", inclusive = false)BigDecimal> numberMinMax; ``` i would expect ```java @Valid private List<@DecimalMin(value = "1", inclusive = true) @DecimalMax(value = "10", inclusive = true)BigDecimal> numberMinMax; ``` According to the [swagger openapi](https://swagger.io/docs/specification/data-models/data-types/) documentation:
``` By default, the minimum and maximum values are included in the range, that is:
minimum ≤ value ≤ maximum
To exclude the boundary values, specify exclusiveMinimum: true and exclusiveMaximum: true. ```
##### openapi-generator version
7.2.0
##### OpenAPI declaration file content or url
<!-- if it is a bug, a json or yaml that produces it. If you post the code inline, please wrap it with ```yaml ``` (for YAML code) or ```json (here your code) ``` (for JSON code), so it becomes more readable. If it is longer than about ten lines, please create a Gist (https://gist.github.com) or upload it somewhere else and link it here. -->
Used API declaration from [issue_17150](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/blob/master/modules/openapi-generator/src/test/resources/3_0/spring/issue_17150.yaml#L70).
```yaml numberMinMax: type: array items: type: number minimum: 1 maximum: 10 ```
##### Command line used for generation
generatorName: spring
##### Steps to reproduce
<!-- unambiguous set of steps to reproduce the bug.-->
- Generate a Java server stub and check the generated code
##### Related issues/PRs
<!-- has a similar issue/PR been reported/opened before? Please do a search in https://github.com/openapitools/openapi-generator/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue%20 -->
The fix for https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/17150 seems not to be 100% accurate.
##### Suggest a fix/enhancement
<!-- if you can't fix the bug yourself, perhaps you can point to what might be causing the problem (line of code or commit), or simply make a suggestion -->
https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/pull/17759

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG] "==" enum value generates "_" in Java which is invalid since Java 9

#### Bug Report Checklist
- [x] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [x] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apidevtools.org/swagger-parser/online/))? - [x] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [x] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [x] What's the actual output vs expected output? - [ ] [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request ([example](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6178))
<!-- Please follow the issue template below for bug reports. Also please indicate in the issue title which language/library is concerned. Eg: [BUG][JAVA] Bug generating foo with bar -->
##### Description
"==" enum value geneates "_" in Java which is invalid since Java 9
##### openapi-generator version
7.2.0-SNAPSHOT
##### OpenAPI declaration file content or url
It's part of the Apache Superset OpenAPI definition
```json "op": { "description": "The comparison operator.", "enum": [ "==", "!=", ">", "<", ">=", "<=", "LIKE", "ILIKE", "IS NULL", "IS NOT NULL", "IN", "NOT IN", "IS TRUE", "IS FALSE", "TEMPORAL_RANGE" ], "example": "IN", "type": "string" }, ```
##### Suggest a fix
PR is comming

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG] [Java/Spring] Openapi Generator 7.4.0 generates Integer Min and Max Values for int64 array instead of Long Values causing compile errors

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column:
#### Bug Report Checklist
- [x] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [x] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apidevtools.org/swagger-parser/online/))? - [x] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [x] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [x] What's the actual output vs expected output? - [ ] [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request ([example](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6178))
##### Description
Related to this [issue](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/18095), in addition to the types already excluded, we should add the case of those listed below
##### openapi-generator version
7.5.0
##### OpenAPI declaration file content or url
```yaml openapi: 3.0.6
info: title: My service version: 2.0.0 description: Layer API
paths: /api/v1/products: post: summary: My summary operationId: operationId1 requestBody: description: Request Body required: true content: application/json: schema: $ref: "#/components/schemas/Product" responses: "200": description: OK status
components: schemas: Product: properties: types: type: array maxItems: 1000 minItems: 1 items: $ref: "#/components/schemas/TypeEnum" TypeEnum: type: string maxLength: 2147483647 enum: - TYPE_1 - TYPE_2 ```
##### Generation Details
``` java -jar openapi-generator-cli-7.5.0.jar generate -g spring -i spec.yaml -o tmp --additional-properties library=spring-boot ```
##### Steps to reproduce
. Generate source: ```java @JsonTypeName("Product") @Generated(value = "com.inditex.amigafwk.common.rest.server.codegen.AmigaSpringCodegen", date = "2024-04-24T10:22:47.180348556+02:00[Europe/Madrid]") public class ProductDTO implements Serializable {
private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
@Valid private List<@Size(max = 2147483647)TypeEnumDTO> types; // Incorrect constraint
//... ```
Trace: ```java jakarta.servlet.ServletException: Request processing failed: jakarta.validation.UnexpectedTypeException: HV000030: No validator could be found for constraint 'jakarta.validation.constraints.Size' validating type ...'
at org.springframework.web.servlet.FrameworkServlet.processRequest(FrameworkServlet.java:1022) at org.springframework.web.servlet.FrameworkServlet.doPost(FrameworkServlet.java:914) at jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:590) at org.springframework.web.servlet.FrameworkServlet.service(FrameworkServlet.java:885) at org.springframework.test.web.servlet.TestDispatcherServlet.service(TestDispatcherServlet.java:72) at jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:658) ```
##### Related issues/PRs
- https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/18095
##### Suggest a fix
Add enums to ModelsUtils#shouldIgnoreBeanValidation

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG] [typescript-fetch] ModelNamePrefix is added twice to import statements thereby breaking the build

#### Bug Report Checklist
- [x] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [x] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apidevtools.org/swagger-parser/online/))? - [x] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [x] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [x] What's the actual output vs expected output? - [ ] [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request ([example](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6178))
<!-- Please follow the issue template below for bug reports. Also please indicate in the issue title which language/library is concerned. Eg: [BUG][JAVA] Bug generating foo with bar -->
##### Description
When generating the model files the prefix is properly added once in front of the generated files. However, in the import statements the prefix is added _twice_ resulting in erroneous statements breaking the build.
When e.g. `SomePrefix` is set for `modelNamePrefix`, then the following model files are generated for `example-for-file-naming-option.yaml`: * `SomePrefixPetCategory.ts` * `SomePrefixPet.ts`
However, _within_ `SomePrefixPet.ts` it looks like this: ```typescript import type { SomePrefixPetCategory } from './SomePrefixSomePrefixPetCategory'; import { SomePrefixPetCategoryFromJSON, SomePrefixPetCategoryFromJSONTyped, SomePrefixPetCategoryToJSON, } from './SomePrefixSomePrefixPetCategory'; ``` I.e. `SomePrefix` is added twice.
##### openapi-generator version
Issue started in version `7.6.0` and is still there in current `master`.
Version `7.5.0` is working fine.
##### OpenAPI declaration file content or url
It can be reproduced using `modules/openapi-generator/src/test/resources/3_0/typescript-fetch/example-for-file-naming-option.yaml` from the repo: https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/blob/v7.6.0/modules/openapi-generator/src/test/resources/3_0/typescript-fetch/example-for-file-naming-option.yaml
##### Generation Details
```shell java -jar modules/openapi-generator-cli/target/openapi-generator-cli.jar generate \ -i modules/openapi-generator/src/test/resources/3_0/typescript-fetch/example-for-file-naming-option.yaml \ -g typescript-fetch \ --additional-properties modelNamePrefix=SomePrefix \ -o generator_out/ ```
##### Steps to reproduce
See command above
##### Related issues/PRs
Nothing found.
##### Suggest a fix
It's probably due to this PR which touched a bit of relevant code between 7.5.0 and 7.6.0: #18284

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG] [typescript-fetch] Incorrect uppercase enum name when having colon

#### Bug Report Checklist
- [ X ] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [ X ] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apidevtools.org/swagger-parser/online/))? - [ X ] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [ X ] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [ X ] What's the actual output vs expected output?
##### Description
When generating a typescript client, the following enum value is not good translated. When using enumPropertyNaming = Uppercase : API : **ASKING_FOR:desc** Generated name (default/pascalCase) : **AskingFoRdesc** Generated name (uppercase) : **ASKING_FO_RDESC**
The real name should be : **ASKING_FOR_DESC**
##### openapi-generator version
Openapi generator used : 7.10.0 In past version (4.3.0) the result name was : **ASKINGFORDESC**
##### OpenAPI declaration file content or url
```yaml openapi: "3.0.0" servers: - url: 'https://lecomptoirdespharmacies.fr/v1' info: description: "This is the REST API of LCDP products" version: "1.0.0" title: "LCDP REST API" termsOfService: "https://www.lecomptoirdespharmacies.fr/mentions-legales" contact: email: "contact@lecomptoirdespharmacies.fr" license: name: "Apache 2.0" url: "http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html" tags: - name: "searchSaleOffer" description: "Search sale offer" paths:
/sale-offers/{saleOfferStatus}: get: tags: - "searchSaleOffer" summary: "Search sale offers by status" operationId: "getSaleOffersByStatus" parameters: - $ref: "#/components/parameters/SaleOfferStatusParameter" responses: 200: description: "Success" 403: description: "Access denied" 400: description: "Bad Request"
components:
parameters: SaleOfferStatusParameter: in: path name: saleOfferStatus required: true schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/SaleOfferStatus'
schemas: SaleOfferStatus: type: string enum: ["ASKING_FOR:desc"] description: "Is this sale offer enabled or not"
```
##### Generation Details
java -jar openapi-generator-cli-7.10.0.jar generate -g typescript-fetch -o output -i openapi.yaml --additional-properties enumPropertyNaming=UPPERCASE
##### Steps to reproduce
1. Run the CLI 2. Go in output/models/SaleOfferStatus.ts to see the bad result
##### Related issues/PRs
* https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/pull/9940 * https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6810
##### Suggest a fix
See https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/pull/20391

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG][python] Clients throws reportPrivateImportUsage when used as a package

#### Bug Report Checklist
- [x] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [x] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apitools.dev/swagger-parser/online/))? - [x] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [x] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [x] What's the actual output vs expected output? - [ ] [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request ([example](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6178))
<!-- Please follow the issue template below for bug reports. Also please indicate in the issue title which language/library is concerned. Eg: [BUG][JAVA] Bug generating foo with bar -->
##### Description
When using any generated python client, files aren't imported as a name, and thus cannot be found. I have already fixed this issue and am opening a pull request that provides a working example and the fix.
##### openapi-generator version
master, latestest
##### OpenAPI declaration file content or url
<!-- if it is a bug, a json or yaml that produces it. If you post the code inline, please wrap it with ```yaml (here your code) ``` (for YAML code) or ```json (here your code) ``` (for JSON code), so it becomes more readable. If it is longer than about ten lines, please create a Gist (https://gist.github.com) or upload it somewhere else and link it here. -->
##### Generation Details
<!-- Prefer CLI steps, including the language, libraries and various options. Providing config-based settings allows for simpler testing across CLI and plugins. For examples, see https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/tree/master/bin/configs -->
##### Steps to reproduce
<!-- unambiguous set of steps to reproduce the bug.-->
##### Related issues/PRs
<!-- has a similar issue/PR been reported/opened before? Please do a search in https://github.com/openapitools/openapi-generator/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue%20 -->
##### Suggest a fix
<!-- if you can't fix the bug yourself, perhaps you can point to what might be causing the problem (line of code or commit), or simply make a suggestion -->
Currently the generated client outputs this: ```python from client.api.my_api import MyApi ```
It should output this: ```python from client.api.my_api import MyApi as MyApi ```
Otherwise the client cannot be imported in a project that uses the generated client as a package.

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG] Kotlin code generator should sanitize enum values according to convention

#### Bug Report Checklist
- [x] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [ ] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apitools.dev/swagger-parser/online/))? - [x] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [x] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [x] What's the actual output vs expected output? - [ ] [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request ([example](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6178))
<!-- Please follow the issue template below for bug reports. Also please indicate in the issue title which language/library is concerned. Eg: [BUG][JAVA] Bug generating foo with bar -->
##### Description
<!-- describe what is the question, suggestion or issue and why this is a problem for you. -->
The Kotlin code generator is not sanitizing enum values correctly. This occurs for hyphenated values where it gets translated to `Minus`.
This was previously addressed in Issue #9683 and partially fixed in PR #16267 (since it does not cover enum values). The fix should be quick to address but let me know if you need me to submit a PR for this
##### openapi-generator version
<!-- which version of openapi-generator are you using, is it a regression? -->
Version 7.13.0
##### OpenAPI declaration file content or url
Any OpenAPI file that contains an enum whose value contains an hyphen: ```yaml properties: propertyName: type: string default: HYPHENATED-VALUE enum: - HYPHENATED-VALUE ```
##### Steps to reproduce
<!-- unambiguous set of steps to reproduce the bug.-->
1. Go to [AbstractKotlinCodegenTest.java](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/blob/master/modules/openapi-generator/src/test/java/org/openapitools/codegen/kotlin/AbstractKotlinCodegenTest.java#L46-L97) 2. Add an assertion for any enum type. Example: `assertEquals(codegen.toEnumVarName("long-Name", null), "longName");` 3. Run the test 4. Verify that it fails. It should be `longName` instead of `longMinusName`
##### Related issues/PRs
<!-- has a similar issue/PR been reported/opened before? Please do a search in https://github.com/openapitools/openapi-generator/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue%20 -->
Similar to Issue #9683 and partially fixed in PR #16267
##### Suggest a fix
<!-- if you can't fix the bug yourself, perhaps you can point to what might be causing the problem (line of code or commit), or simply make a suggestion -->
Replace line `modified = value;` with `modified = sanitizeName(value, "\\W-[\\$]");` in [AbstractKotlinCodegen.java](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/blob/d04c0ddbb4b7037adfffe5996807f6bbd209fbf6/modules/openapi-generator/src/main/java/org/openapitools/codegen/languages/AbstractKotlinCodegen.java#L575) Add unit tests for the different enum properties. Example: 1. original -> `long-Name` becomes `longMinusName` 2. snake_case -> `long-Name` becomes `long_name` 3. camelCase -> `long-Name` becomes `longName` 4. PascalCase -> `long-Name` becomes `LongName` 5. UPPERCASE -> `long-Name` becomes `LONG_NAME`

table.name: openapi-generator
table.column: [BUG][RUST] New AbstractRustCodegen.java not handling period-delimited model names well.

#### Bug Report Checklist
- [X] Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue? - [X] Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator ([example](https://apidevtools.org/swagger-parser/online/))? - [X] Have you [tested with the latest master](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/wiki/FAQ#how-to-test-with-the-latest-master-of-openapi-generator) to confirm the issue still exists? - [X] Have you searched for related issues/PRs? - [X] What's the actual output vs expected output? - [ ] [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request ([example](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/issues/6178))
##### Description
I am working with the [Microsoft Graph API specification](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/microsoftgraph/msgraph-metadata/master/openapi/v1.0/openapi.yaml) (although I used `yq -o=json eval openapi.yaml > openapi.json` to convert to a JSON spec first, since there are too many Yaml code points for swagger-parser in v6.5.0 of openapi-generator). It has models named in the following format:
* `microsoft.graph.user` * `microsoft.graph.authenticationMethod` * `microsoft.graph.fido2AuthenticationMethod`
etc. The Rust client generator is outputting the following warnings:
> [main] WARN o.o.c.languages.AbstractRustCodegen - MicrosoftGraphFido2AuthenticationMethod cannot be used as a model name. Renamed to MicrosoftPeriodGraphPeriodFido2AuthenticationMethod
> [main] WARN o.o.c.languages.AbstractRustCodegen - microsoft/graph/fido2_authentication_method cannot be used as a model file name. Renamed to microsoft_period_graph_period_fido2_authentication_method
This output is perplexing, as `MicrosoftGraphFido2AuthenticationMethod` post-sanitizing is completely legitimate for Rust, but it still performs another pass and adds `Period` in placements where `.` is in the original model name.
Likewise, the module file pathing `microsoft/graph/fido2_authentication_method` would be perfectly legitimate (assuming proper supporting `mod.rs` files were generated along the path) as a module path and file name. Or if not that `microsoft_graph_fido2_authentication_method` would be perfectly good as well, without the added `_period` separator in the module path name.
I realize these may be two separate issues, but since `Period` and `_period` are likely rooted with the same failing to handle `.` delimited model names, I bet they can be solved together.
##### openapi-generator version
6.5.0
##### OpenAPI declaration file content or url
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/microsoftgraph/msgraph-metadata/master/openapi/v1.0/openapi.yaml
converted to json with:
``` yq -o=json eval openapi.yaml > openapi.json ```
##### Generation Details
``` openapi-generator generate -g rust \ -i openapi.json \ -o ms-graph-rust \ --additional-properties=useSingleRequestParameter=true \ --skip-validate-spec ```
##### Steps to reproduce
1. Download the openapi.yaml spec. 2. Convert to openapi.json spec. 3. Run the above command, see all of the WARN output.
##### Suggest a fix
I briefly reviewed the AbstractRustCodegen class and how its calling down into DefaultCodegen for various name sanitizing and character replacement, but didn't dig very deep. I feel like the owner of AbstractRustCodegen will know of a good way to handle this issue immediately after reading this description.
